text: 12 ounce can. Bright orange pour. Big apple taste (as I guess all cider has) and then whiskey and overall booze. Big.

Tap. Pours clear pale golden, small dizzy white head, dissipates quickly, minimal lacing. Aroma is apples, a bit of funk, oak and whiskey. Flavor is fully sweet, light tart, light funk, tart apple and Whiskey. Medium body. Tasty shit. Zeszty

On tap at Chucks on 85th, pours a clear pale blonde with a small white head. Aroma brings out notes of honey and acidic red apples. Flavour is huge, with honey, red apples and intense acidity. Wonderful blend of mead and cider. Finishes acidity and boozy, but in the best of ways. Very good.
Aroma is strong whiskey/liquor and apples. The flavor is whiskey/liquor, apples, tart/sweet in the middle and an alcoholic/slightly burning finish.

It pours dull golden orange with no head. The aroma has rich sweetness which is presumably from apples and honey,, both of which are there. Theres is a distinct booziness asking with oak, vanilla, grainy wood and pears. It has a full slick body with no carbonation and a creamy velvety feel. The taste is very deceptive with the alcohol, just a mere hint on the finish. The gate has honey and rich apples, but there is also a raspberry taste and lots of vanilla, traces of caramel and some peppery spice. Very nicely made.

Can from a Lazy Dog
Slightly hazy light golden color with no head, not sure if this is supposed to be carbonated but this can was flat. Sweet syrupy apple with bit of brown sugar and a light woody oak. Pretty decent cider.
Draft at Black Squirrel. Hazy pale yellow color. Aroma of floral apple. Taste is sweet spiced herbal apple, dryish finish. Nice.

On draught. 
Pours a pale golden & is basically still. 

Teh aroma has some wood & baking spice. Its only lightly sweet smelling and has some light tart apples and a nice honey character. 

The flavor is spicy and plesantly sweet. Its got tart apples and a nice bitter apple rind character. The booziness is warming and it gives the mead a sort of brandy like character.

Draft to stemmed wine glass. This is an apple mead, so Im not sure if. It should be categorized as cider (which it currently is) or a mead. Looks good for the style; a transparent gold with some light carbonation that fades fairly quickly after the pour. Some bubbly white lacing as well. Smells solid; a nice mix of tart apples and honey. Tastes like it smells, but richer, with more of a honey presence alongside soft notes of vanilla. Mouthfeel is medium full-bodied and smooth, especially for the abv. Tasty stuff that drinks more like a mead than a cider.
Draft - pours yellow - nose/taste of rye, apple, bourbon and honey apple - medium body

Very tiny bubbles, burnt orange color. No head. Theres a lot of baked apple here. and honestly that 13% ABV is so well hidden. I cant believe its not mead! Very interesting. pear juice, some cherry hidden away and a lot of sweetness. almost cloying but impressively crafted.
On tap at LB Plaudit. Slightly hazy good, medium body, low carbonation, and no lacing. Taste is sweet tart apples with a long rich finish. Quite good.

On tap @ Haven Gastropub. Clear straw color with some short lived white foam. Sweet and syrupy all the way through. Maybe some honey and apple pie filling. A touch of bitter dry spices and apple skins. Comes off as a bit grainy to me. No real acidity or balance. Boozy. Goopy.
Tap..Pour is golden with a bubbly white head..Nose is fresh cut apple, honey, oak, musty, spice..Tatse is honey, oak, spice, fresh apple, vanilla, sweet, wow
Tap. Golden with minimal head. Huge honey sweetness. Light apple. Medium booze. A sipper, but great flavor.
Draft - Tons of honey. Clear gold. Sweet honey, light green apple and a touch of peel bitterness. Nice and rich.
Definitely a sipping cider. High alcohol. A sweet, still cider with a touch of honey and brown sugar. Outstanding if its something youre in the mood for.
